section.text: Good afternoon. So I was interested in two topics. One is, what you might be seeing in terms of seller expectations or just general observations about domestic M&A? And what's going on with TCF multiples?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jon Atkin", "section_number": 1, "uuid": "2183b362-3046-4e72-87bf-305e4409f971", "speaker_title": "Analyst at RBC Capital Markets"}

section.text: And then secondly, in your conversations with your US customers interested in -- or to what degree -- or densification or cell-splitting starting to come out as opposed to overlays, which I think has been driving the majority of the growth ex-DISH so far? Thanks.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "Jon Atkin", "section_number": 1, "uuid": "2183b362-3046-4e72-87bf-305e4409f971", "speaker_title": "Analyst at RBC Capital Markets"}

section.text: Yeah, I'll take the last one first, Jon. We're still, at least with respect to SBA and its assets, in the capacity stage and the overlay and the initial deployment of mid-band spectrum. While we fully expect densification to come capacity for us continues to be the current driver. Now we take that as a good thing because that really just lengthens out the extent of the activity timeline for us.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jeffrey A. Stoops", "section_number": 2, "uuid": "186d83c3-82a5-483b-821f-6eb85ccc25a1", "speaker_title": "Director, President and Chief Executive Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: In terms of seller expectations, -- changing some, they have not fully reset to the degree that the public company multiples have compressed. What that means for SBA is, there'll be a lot of things that we take a pass on unless the price is right. We loved what we did in Tanzania, we loved what we did in GTS. There's a lot of things that we passed on because those expect -- there is still a gap in those seller expectations but they have started to move actually down.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "Jeffrey A. Stoops", "section_number": 2, "uuid": "186d83c3-82a5-483b-821f-6eb85ccc25a1", "speaker_title": "Director, President and Chief Executive Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: And then lastly just on the international M&A and tuck-in opportunities build-to-suits, what's your appetite for that at the moment?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jon Atkin", "section_number": 3, "uuid": "e606b572-eccf-4408-91c1-3fdbe76ead16", "speaker_title": "Analyst at RBC Capital Markets"}

section.text: We like to build-to-suits provided they're the right terms. Tuck-in acquisitions and, for that matter, new markets, would all fall into kind of the same comment I made about finding things that are right for us. And we're only going to do things if we believe that is right for us from a price and a growth perspective.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jeffrey A. Stoops", "section_number": 4, "uuid": "24892b26-4ee7-4451-9036-2331088bc8c9", "speaker_title": "Director, President and Chief Executive Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: And, if we do things, great. If we don't, you'll see what happened in the third-quarter which is that we de-lever pretty quickly until we do see those right capital allocation opportunities.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "Jeffrey A. Stoops", "section_number": 4, "uuid": "24892b26-4ee7-4451-9036-2331088bc8c9", "speaker_title": "Director, President and Chief Executive Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: Excellent. Thanks very much.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jon Atkin", "section_number": 5, "uuid": "ba984582-644e-486a-a37d-ecb70d17c31c", "speaker_title": "Analyst at RBC Capital Markets"}

section.text: Thanks, and good afternoon. I'm curious if you could just share a little bit more details of the backlog. And are you still seeing an extended book-to-bill where it's just taking longer for that backlog to get into the actual revenue numbers?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Michael Rollins", "section_number": 7, "uuid": "cede1ad0-4dff-40ad-9c8b-d421fe9d5257", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Citi"}

section.text: And then separately on data centers and edge opportunities, any updates on how you're looking at the opportunities? Have some of your tests are coming along? Thank you.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "Michael Rollins", "section_number": 7, "uuid": "cede1ad0-4dff-40ad-9c8b-d421fe9d5257", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Citi"}

section.text: Yeah. I don't know. Brendan, correct me if I'm wrong. But I don't know that we've had any changes in the book-to-bill. Brendon?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jeffrey A. Stoops", "section_number": 8, "uuid": "f37cd502-32f8-4c4b-8560-ae207fbc983a", "speaker_title": "Director, President and Chief Executive Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: Nothing material. I will say that actually, if you noticed in our -- on our bridge for domestic contributions from new leases and amendments that we did up that contribution for 2022, 66 last quarter and 67 now. And that change is really largely due to a slight acceleration in timing and that's mostly around amendments that just kicked in a little bit quicker than we had projected. But it's a pretty small change relative to the big-picture. I don't think there's been any material move in -- that you would point out.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Brendan T. Cavanagh", "section_number": 9, "uuid": "089194a6-893a-4978-9d00-7a07ae4534cc", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: And on the edge business, Mike, we've actually seen some great progress but it's still -- it's great from who we started, which was of course zero. But it's not really material. I would say we probably have either in operation or under construction 30 to 40 of these facilities and the primary demand for them has been edge computing and fiber and cable regeneration. But what we found to be the key to success in this area is really the state -- the state of and the location of the tower site. Because where it's ready to go and it's close to or on-top of existing fiber mix all that much more attractive.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jeffrey A. Stoops", "section_number": 10, "uuid": "5add31dd-b274-4c1a-ba9e-82ab1583bc78", "speaker_title": "Director, President and Chief Executive Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: So on an absolute basis, yes, we've seen a lot of growth. On a financial basis, it's still of course very small but we're encouraged by what we've seen.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "Jeffrey A. Stoops", "section_number": 10, "uuid": "5add31dd-b274-4c1a-ba9e-82ab1583bc78", "speaker_title": "Director, President and Chief Executive Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: And within that context, is there a base expectation of the value enhancement. So if you look at what these 30 to 40 sites could do from an incremental cash flow, incremental value perspective? Is there a number that we all should be keeping in mind as the opportunity set?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Michael Rollins", "section_number": 11, "uuid": "227cefec-79b5-479a-8721-bd81add538fb", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Citi"}

section.text: No because it's still small. What I will tell you though is that, we're really happy with the -- with the incremental return on invested capital for these projects and at its core that's what, I think you have hired us to do. So we're very happy with that and as long as we can make that return on invested capital, albeit small perhaps, for at least a little while, we're going to keep doing it.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jeffrey A. Stoops", "section_number": 12, "uuid": "00b13587-cd20-4594-8f0f-34ce0cf20a40", "speaker_title": "Director, President and Chief Executive Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: Thank you.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Michael Rollins", "section_number": 13, "uuid": "ae470702-200d-411d-b9a3-049e31bdd584", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Citi"}

section.text: Yes. Good afternoon, everybody.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Richard Prentiss", "section_number": 15, "uuid": "e5cb2d7b-fefa-45bb-8f63-95ca01f380bb", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Raymond James & Associates, Inc."}

section.text: Hey Rick.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jeffrey A. Stoops", "section_number": 16, "uuid": "f3a75ffb-f1bb-4832-89d8-2899d98e3f12", "speaker_title": "Director, President and Chief Executive Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: Hey, certainly it's [Phonetic] treats versus tricks tonight. Thanks, Jeff. First -- first question, I'd like to get into is, there's a lot of debate out there, when you look at the US business, it, sounds like you have good visibility. So a Leading indicator of services business sounds strong with record backlog, but when you get the questions of, aren't the carriers trimming capex budget, if you look at '23 versus '22, not a perfect indicator capex? Potential for a recession in the US, interest rates are high, does anybody needs to go borrow to pay their capex, help us understand how you're feeling? It sounds quite positive, Jeff as far as looking -- exiting '22 strong and then looking into '23 strong?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Richard Prentiss", "section_number": 17, "uuid": "798793ea-b632-48db-ab4a-2f1a563f6983", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Raymond James & Associates, Inc."}

section.text: Well, keep in mind, because of the nature of the business where you sign things up today, but you don't begin to recognize revenue until later that we're today already shaping next year's financial results. So that's -- that's -- that's a point of confidence. The other thing, I would say is that we track to the tower, which of our customers have upgraded their mid-band spectrum on our sites. And -- and the number is actually fairly low across the board for us at this point. And -- you know, our customers will do what they will do, but knowing what this means for them in terms of the amount of money, frankly, for first of all what they spend on the spectrum, the -- at least as reported competitive differences between some of them from a spectrum perspective and others, where they are on our towers and the fact that the capex numbers that you get from them are extremely broad. We feel next year is going to be pretty good.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jeffrey A. Stoops", "section_number": 18, "uuid": "9e46b99d-e7af-4d83-8899-60040a07eef3", "speaker_title": "Director, President and Chief Executive Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: Okay. Other question, obviously closed Grupo TorreSur, how should we think about the funding for that business in this environment? And as we look into '23, how much more interest expense should we be kind of already starting to think about from our side, I know, you haven't given guidance yet, but thinking about what that headwind might be and does stock -- do stock buybacks come back on the -- on the radar as we get into this year or early next year?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Richard Prentiss", "section_number": 19, "uuid": "d8349726-3a50-4583-908e-76e12407b720", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Raymond James & Associates, Inc."}

section.text: Yeah, well, Grupo TorreSure is funded. I mean that's -- that's you say, think about the funding, that's already funded. That got funded from cash on hand and our -- and our revolver. So the next thing we're looking at is the refinancing of the $640 million ABS instrument in March where we got that teed-up ready to go. I don't want to speculate too much on the interest increase, there will be of course at interest increase. I mean, Brendan, what's that instrument-bearing today?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jeffrey A. Stoops", "section_number": 20, "uuid": "6563bda1-f842-4ed1-8ba7-5e17cc6ade4d", "speaker_title": "Director, President and Chief Executive Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: The one that's getting paid-off is just below 3.5%, so you should expect that that will be significantly higher.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Brendan T. Cavanagh", "section_number": 21, "uuid": "05205186-853e-4ede-a2e7-1d8b24a92901", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: Well, let's -- let's put a little parameters around that. I mean we're thinking -- we're thinking it's going to have a six handle on it, Rick.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jeffrey A. Stoops", "section_number": 22, "uuid": "6123d6ce-cdf2-4d77-ac6a-461779a0dad1", "speaker_title": "Director, President and Chief Executive Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: Okay. Okay.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Richard Prentiss", "section_number": 23, "uuid": "871958dd-93a6-4d54-a535-bcf92952dab8", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Raymond James & Associates, Inc."}

section.text: But then -- but then -- but then keep in mind, we're going to be producing over $1 billion of AFFO. We don't have another debt instrument due until October of 2024. So we're going to be in great shape. We're going to have capital to invest and it's either going to get -- we're either going to see value in portfolio acquisitions. Based on my earlier comments, we may or may not. We're going to be continue to be opportunistic around stock repurchases or third and I would say this is somewhat unlikely given the first two, you're going to see a big decline in our leverage ratio.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jeffrey A. Stoops", "section_number": 24, "uuid": "b0192eac-b4da-4538-a47b-7ec9468eb727", "speaker_title": "Director, President and Chief Executive Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: That helps a lot. [Indecipherable]
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Richard Prentiss", "section_number": 25, "uuid": "6361cef9-bf10-4a0d-8a90-bc2c036955a8", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Raymond James & Associates, Inc."}

section.text: Hi, this is Landon on for Simon. Thanks for taking the question. I was wondering if you could expand on any specifics domestically from what you're seeing from -- from Dish or any of the other carriers in terms of where you think they're at in their -- their deployments?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Unidentified Participant", "section_number": 27, "uuid": "ca3296ce-cb82-4737-8818-34f5ac766497", "speaker_title": "at SBA Communications"}

section.text: Yeah. I don't want to get too granular. All -- all of the -- well, let's say, T-Mobile, Verizon and AT&T, all still have work-to-do with us based on our analysis of where they are with their mid-band spectrum. Some of those are further headwind others, and I think the answer to that question has been well reported. And then Dish has really got a lot of business signed up and their focus right now is getting all that on air to meet the June 2023 requirements, which based on everything we can tell they're in a very good position to do. And then we expect them to come back and begin to work on the 2025 requirements. So, while -- while, it's varied landed in terms of which of those are busiest. And I -- I don't think they want me actually commenting on that. I will tell you that, there is a high-level of busyness from all of them and they all, at least based on our analysis still have a lot to work -- a lot of work left to do on our portfolio.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jeffrey A. Stoops", "section_number": 28, "uuid": "3337af3b-ff33-435d-957d-97cde6e35f69", "speaker_title": "Director, President and Chief Executive Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: Thanks for that color, Jeff. And then just one follow-up on the edge deployment commentary. Can you maybe describe what these sites look like, 30 to 40 that are in operation or under construction, build costs, size of the facilities? And maybe what percent of your sites, do you think are potentially eligible over time to have such deployments?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Unidentified Participant", "section_number": 29, "uuid": "31ed7fef-8864-4912-a849-a928090bb163", "speaker_title": "at SBA Communications"}

section.text: Yeah. I think they are mostly 6x12 foot or 10x20 foot shelters that look like the traditional wireless shelter, that certain carriers have used historically. They've got air-conditioning, they've got a lot of logistics to check temperatures and alarms and things like that. They basically are for racks of equipment and they start out with two or three rack capacity and can be expanded beyond that. And Brendan what are we -- what's our average cost on those?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jeffrey A. Stoops", "section_number": 30, "uuid": "9c0d6a95-4bf9-4565-aa86-ea8c3e9bb645", "speaker_title": "Director, President and Chief Executive Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: It depends on the size and the scale obviously -- the deployment there. For something along the lines of what Jeff described, you're looking at somewhere in the $100,000 range. But if we do a bigger, more fulsome edge computed through data center, we're worth a bigger operation, it can be as much as $400,000 or $500,000.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Brendan T. Cavanagh", "section_number": 31, "uuid": "162fcc89-75cb-4cff-8032-dc2215081a4f", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: And, how much power do you have -- would you have going to those facilities?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Unidentified Participant", "section_number": 32, "uuid": "d81c96bb-3aee-4d43-b44e-f2cc0c5cccae", "speaker_title": "at SBA Communications"}

section.text: Yeah, they are not -- at that size, they're not being sold on a -- on a traditional data center power basis. A lot of -- a lot of the users today are for regeneration of signal, for cable and fiber companies and that's -- that's not really how that's priced and so --
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jeffrey A. Stoops", "section_number": 33, "uuid": "b54572f6-cf3f-4df6-af67-53f8671a5baa", "speaker_title": "Director, President and Chief Executive Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: Okay. Thanks very much for the color.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Unidentified Participant", "section_number": 34, "uuid": "22c246db-160e-4fcd-b15c-40b6c2ad6708", "speaker_title": "at SBA Communications"}

section.text: Thanks. Jeff just going back to Rick's question. Can you give us or define what low means in terms of the number of cell sites of that mid-band? You're talking like sub 10%, sub 20%, something in the ballpark?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Walter Piecyk", "section_number": 36, "uuid": "84c05409-c420-494d-b8d7-4cc1b3eecfad", "speaker_title": "Analyst at LightShed Ventures"}

section.text: The most -- the most populated of the carriers would be -- their -- their satisfaction rate on our towers would be in the 50%-ish range and others are below that.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jeffrey A. Stoops", "section_number": 37, "uuid": "774d60c6-ffa1-4e89-a22c-296eafe48ef6", "speaker_title": "Director, President and Chief Executive Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: Got it. And then Comcast has this radio from Samsung that does 2.5 and it has low-band in there. I guess, first -- first part of the question is, have you had any type of meaningful dialog with Comcast and Charter about helping them with their offload strategy? But then more importantly, I guess, when that inevitability does happen, if you look at like three scenarios, one where they just said, hey, we have a radio that just does CBRS and the antenna that goes along with that.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Walter Piecyk", "section_number": 38, "uuid": "718ec9a0-b20b-4933-bd6b-5e7505e332fa", "speaker_title": "Analyst at LightShed Ventures"}

section.text: Scenario two is we're doing low band and CBRS, so that's probably a different type of antenna, maybe larger. And then the third alternative is the low band that they have is deeper, meaning like rather than 5 megahertz in Comcast case, they go out, they lease some additional low band and they're using 10 megahertz of spectrum. Would the leases differ between those three scenarios? Because I've seen that you recall over the past many years that you would argue that like, hey, when someone put on the spectrum, we get more money. So for a new leaser or a new tenant, would it be the same way where if they came to you with one of those three alternatives that there would be different pricing?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "Walter Piecyk", "section_number": 38, "uuid": "718ec9a0-b20b-4933-bd6b-5e7505e332fa", "speaker_title": "Analyst at LightShed Ventures"}

section.text: Just based on the nature of the spectrum is being transmitted?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jeffrey A. Stoops", "section_number": 39, "uuid": "83490c1e-aa64-40f3-af53-26010ad353a1", "speaker_title": "Director, President and Chief Executive Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: Yeah.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Walter Piecyk", "section_number": 40, "uuid": "0fe6fdce-84b9-4748-a93c-bf1cf21a15af", "speaker_title": "Analyst at LightShed Ventures"}

section.text: Probably not. Probably it's all going to be based on the way the equipment looks. And based on your description of the third alternative lower band, deeper lower band. I mean, as you're describing it, I'm envisioning that's going to be the most intensive on the equipment side. So they would be based on that, Walt, as opposed to the fact that they're transmitting their own. I mean, even though CBRS is shared and not necessarily owned, we wouldn't differentiate somebody's use of CBRS versus their use of their own spectrum, I don't believe. I don't think we ever have put it that way.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jeffrey A. Stoops", "section_number": 41, "uuid": "8d7d7d23-221b-450f-ae8c-dc9cb1f66075", "speaker_title": "Director, President and Chief Executive Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: And has there been any meaningful discussions up to this point?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Walter Piecyk", "section_number": 42, "uuid": "a7e6f03e-507c-44e0-88b0-0a209263c1fa", "speaker_title": "Analyst at LightShed Ventures"}

section.text: We're always in discussions with Charter and Comcast. But I would say that those scenarios that you lay out, I -- from my personal opinion, I think there's still somewhat in the future.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jeffrey A. Stoops", "section_number": 43, "uuid": "eb1d048a-19ba-4d94-95d3-0a7dfe0c7ff8", "speaker_title": "Director, President and Chief Executive Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: Got it. Thank you. Yeah, understood very well I believe, hopefully.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Walter Piecyk", "section_number": 44, "uuid": "aeac9fd0-5c35-4763-a5e1-ff3098078f9a", "speaker_title": "Analyst at LightShed Ventures"}

section.text: Great. Thank you. Can you remind us the overall financial impact of the GTS side if there are any changes to the original expectation? And how much revenue was pulled forward? And network services, you mentioned the strength and you added more to the backlog, could we expect a similar performance next year on that segment? Thank you.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Batya Levi", "section_number": 46, "uuid": "a8bdf768-216b-410a-8cc8-019abe2bb45d", "speaker_title": "Analyst at UBS"}

section.text: Yes. GTS, the numbers aren't any different than what we gave last quarter. So the total revenue on an annualized basis is expected to be approximately USD72 million. The impact from the pull forward of closing a little bit early was about $3 million.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Brendan T. Cavanagh", "section_number": 47, "uuid": "a9a4127d-0a29-426b-8a51-9ea2a9927ed9", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: Yeah, and in terms of services, I mean we have a backlog that supports a fourth-quarter performance similar to what we enjoyed in the third-quarter that's not what we've guided to because we exceeded our expectations so greatly in Q3 and Q4 has some holidays and all that. And in terms of next year, we really wouldn't hazard a guess until we have the benefit over the next four or five months prior to when we give out full-year 2023 guidance.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jeffrey A. Stoops", "section_number": 48, "uuid": "4d61b164-7b7f-4834-95fe-1e9d0e528e6e", "speaker_title": "Director, President and Chief Executive Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: Okay. Thank you.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Batya Levi", "section_number": 49, "uuid": "cc5ae5f9-5401-4ecb-83a9-4798f8856f56", "speaker_title": "Analyst at UBS"}

section.text: Hey, good evening, guys. Thanks for taking my questions. Yeah -- first, just looking at the change in guidance, what's the jump-in other revenue in the US coming from? Is that decommissioning fees or something similar? And how much of that was in Q3 versus what you expect in Q4?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Nick Del Deo", "section_number": 51, "uuid": "f6e3194e-f8cd-4396-bc05-d916b5303a30", "speaker_title": "Analyst at MoffettNathason"}

section.text: Yeah, it was -- almost all of the jump is related to Q3, I would say. And it is related -- largely it's a variety of things but cash basis revenues, a portion of that -- a big chunk of that is related to what we might call holdover fees, extra fees that are paid for somebody staying on the tower that's coming off but they stay longer than they should.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jeffrey A. Stoops", "section_number": 52, "uuid": "63ab15ff-5198-4977-b80d-7f5ad68170da", "speaker_title": "Director, President and Chief Executive Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: It also includes internationally payments from Digicel. We mentioned, Digicel is a big contributor to the churn number internationally which they are but they've actually continued to make a number of payments and so those payments are showing up basically in other now.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "Jeffrey A. Stoops", "section_number": 52, "uuid": "63ab15ff-5198-4977-b80d-7f5ad68170da", "speaker_title": "Director, President and Chief Executive Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: Okay, okay, that's great. And I guess, I also wanted to ask about expense trends that you're observing in the US. Obviously, the majority of your OpEx is ground rent escalators and that are fixed so it takes a lot of risk off the table. So what are you seeing and expecting as it relates to the rest of your expense base? Corporate, field operations, and so on?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Nick Del Deo", "section_number": 53, "uuid": "f5a14be3-0e9d-469f-bd94-69546fae426c", "speaker_title": "Analyst at MoffettNathason"}

section.text: We are seeing definitely some inflationary pressure there, Nick. And we're going to be given out average compensation increases. Next year at a higher-rate than we've given in the last couple of years. But when you look at -- think we're -- our SG&A is only like 6% of cash -- cash SG&A 6% of revenue. I mean it just really doesn't matter on the overall financial numbers. But we'd be lying to you if we said we were immune to that kind of stuff but for us it's just so much smaller of a percentage and it is for a lot of other companies.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jeffrey A. Stoops", "section_number": 54, "uuid": "70f6bafd-b521-4a43-93b9-0f97884ecd63", "speaker_title": "Director, President and Chief Executive Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: Okay, okay. That's great. If I can squeeze in one last quick one. Obviously, as we look at the growth overseas, the value of the CPI-linked escalators are really showing their value in the current environment, are there any caps on major contracts that we should be cognizant of where you guys untapped on that front and hence essentially, totally protected?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Nick Del Deo", "section_number": 55, "uuid": "20f9555b-90ef-4076-a64c-10db3029e400", "speaker_title": "Analyst at MoffettNathason"}

section.text: We're largely uncapped. I'm trying to think if there are any. There may be one or two somewhere out there. But for the most part, it's not capped.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Brendan T. Cavanagh", "section_number": 56, "uuid": "65a4a96d-7933-438e-8208-6d789b3f666d", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: Okay, okay. Terrific. Thank you.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Nick Del Deo", "section_number": 57, "uuid": "33d1c317-f02e-438f-8432-00989ff73667", "speaker_title": "Analyst at MoffettNathason"}

section.text: Great. Thanks for taking my questions. I have two if I may. Can we talk about your Latin-American churn. If I look at your guidance it should be still up here on these 8% levels. I'm just trying to figure out how much of that spills over into 2023 or do we remain at 80% levels for the next few quarters given the OI cadence and the consolidation churn and Digicel etc,.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Greg Williams", "section_number": 59, "uuid": "e9f6df55-d527-4fdf-8006-25cf6f2abbec", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Cowen"}

section.text: Second question is just on the service revenue. Actually, the service margins profile had expect that to pan-out are you shifting from a permitting to more construction? I think you hit a margin close to 26% and wanted to where that shakes out over the next few quarters? Thanks.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "Greg Williams", "section_number": 59, "uuid": "e9f6df55-d527-4fdf-8006-25cf6f2abbec", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Cowen"}

section.text: Yeah, I mean, I'll take the latter question first. And Brendan you can do the American churn. We're executing very well, Greg, on both the traditional permitting and zoning side of the business as well as the construction side. So the margin differential that you saw years ago between those two lines of our services business, those -- they're not exactly the same but the gap is closed tremendously.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jeffrey A. Stoops", "section_number": 60, "uuid": "bc0ed66f-e34e-41c0-ba51-029e854a05f5", "speaker_title": "Director, President and Chief Executive Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: So we still get a better margin on the zoning and permitting side of things that we do on the construction so the mix of that will impact the margins. But I mean I don't think it's going to be hugely different margin next year. I think based on the way the work will flow and how we expect things to come in for business that has I mean the first business that we typically see for any kind of new interest is going to be on the zoning and permitting side. So I think it's -- I've got to change a whole lot.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "Jeffrey A. Stoops", "section_number": 60, "uuid": "bc0ed66f-e34e-41c0-ba51-029e854a05f5", "speaker_title": "Director, President and Chief Executive Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: Yeah. And then, Greg, on the international churn piece, I would expect that the next couple of quarters few quarters probably will be in a similar range in terms of that percentage that you're looking at because of the timing of when some of those stuff started. The one thing I'd also caveat about next year is just obviously only takes into account what's happened now and there is -- the one big thing that's out there that were in the midst of conversations about is related to the OI consolidation in Brazil.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Brendan T. Cavanagh", "section_number": 61, "uuid": "48b84187-5e50-46c7-87a5-e758aa0c58c3", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: And as of today, there's nothing to report on that but as we continue to have conversations depending on where those end-up, that may influence what next year's numbers look like.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "Brendan T. Cavanagh", "section_number": 61, "uuid": "48b84187-5e50-46c7-87a5-e758aa0c58c3", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: Got it. Thank you.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Greg Williams", "section_number": 62, "uuid": "f1f9fe85-3af7-411e-bf39-e15fd92e40b0", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Cowen"}

section.text: Hey, guys. Thanks so much for taking the questions. I got a bunch, Jeff, for you. I think the first, most important is what are you going out for trigger treating tonight with your kid? The second --
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "David Barden", "section_number": 64, "uuid": "4f99727c-5899-491b-91f8-121f8ea29efb", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Bank of America"}

section.text: I'm going as a grandfather.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jeffrey A. Stoops", "section_number": 65, "uuid": "268df62e-939b-4fd6-b488-4055cc39099d", "speaker_title": "Director, President and Chief Executive Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: I'm still interested in the costume. So the second question is, you kind of highlighted the leverage being below the target. You know there was a time when you guys implemented your dividend that you thought maybe a lower leverage target would be the right target. I wondered if you would want to have a little bit of a conversation about how you're thinking about target leverage and given that there's not a ton to do on acquisitions and you didn't do stock buybacks even though stocks been pulling back, whether there has been some sort of change there. The --
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "David Barden", "section_number": 66, "uuid": "2f1fbc87-7293-46e4-b94e-316850af6026", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Bank of America"}

section.text: There really hasn't -- there really hasn't been a change there. I mean, clearly, we've maintained our target but have operated almost entirely at the low-end now for some time. And I think that's going to continue to be the case if not dropping below. But the dropping below if that happens, is going to be more a function of our dissatisfaction with poor capital allocation opportunities and some financial theoretical belief that this is the optimum leverage level, given our access to capital. And one of the thing -- and you may be driving it, Dave, we're not going to turn into a high dividend relative to AFFO company. We just don't think that's the right thing to do. We will grow our dividend probably as faster, faster than -- well certainly our peers and maybe anybody else in the REIT industry as we have the last couple of years, but it's still going to be lower as a percentage of AFFO because we like the flexibility that it provides.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jeffrey A. Stoops", "section_number": 67, "uuid": "9ba95db6-69f7-42ed-9197-d570ebae2bfd", "speaker_title": "Director, President and Chief Executive Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: Okay. Great. And then the second question, I had was, one of the things that distinguishes you guys from peers has been a pivot to fixed rate debt, obviously that changed a little bit with GTS. I think someone asked earlier about the plan for the GTS that you guys talked about the refinancing of the ABS. But I don't -- what is the plan for the variable rate debt in the portfolio? I guess this is one for, Mark. Are you going to go -- are you going to lock-in higher fixed rates, so you're going to try to ride it out in the meantime?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "David Barden", "section_number": 68, "uuid": "ef664cab-50c3-4abb-a2cb-198f2f3d1725", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Bank of America"}

section.text: It'll be a mix of both. We have, as you probably have noticed from our prior ABS financings, where we have the opportunity to raise more than the amount to be refinanced. We have -- we have been rated for issuance well above 640 [Phonetic]. We're -- we're trying to figure out exactly how far above that, that we go. So there'll be -- there'll be some reduction in the revolver from that and then the rest of it is going to occur pretty quickly from cash flow.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Mark DeRussy", "section_number": 69, "uuid": "37676137-8564-4158-82bb-e1e58f96483a", "speaker_title": "Vice President of Finance at SBA Communications"}

section.text: Perfect. Okay. Good. Thank you. And then, my last question if I could, please, Jeff, is -- I've always kind of considered you a little bit of a Brazilian policy wonk. Now that the election is over, how -- what do you think is next in terms of implications for the telecom industry, currency etc.? Thank you.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "David Barden", "section_number": 70, "uuid": "8506bc4d-42bc-4d60-827c-f3b04f217e99", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Bank of America"}

section.text: Well, we all know the Lula is left of Bolsonaro. But he has gotten elected by a coalition of not only the more leftist, but also some more centrist populations as well. At the same time that Lula got elected President, the Congress down there got actually more to the right. So you're going to have a classic draw between the President and between Congress, and Congress has a lot of power in Brazil. So, I think for us, it's going to continue to be kind of a good business environment without a lot of policy changes -- that's, I mean -- I think the, whatever -- whatever -- and I don't know that, he would have proposed anything. But assuming for hypothetical purposes that Lula proposed some things that would be very much to the left and detrimental to business, I don't think that's going to happen because of the Congress.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jeffrey A. Stoops", "section_number": 71, "uuid": "33ad21dc-d64e-403b-a1c5-005733436bc1", "speaker_title": "Director, President and Chief Executive Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: Yeah. Okay. Thank you guys. I really appreciate it.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "David Barden", "section_number": 72, "uuid": "5fd29206-1525-46ef-92f5-c81437e3c9b9", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Bank of America"}

section.text: Sure.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jeffrey A. Stoops", "section_number": 73, "uuid": "64ce3dc3-dd5b-4246-877a-2f455ea8c9a6", "speaker_title": "Director, President and Chief Executive Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: Hey, Jeff, I wanted to make sure, I'm understanding your enthusiasm for domestic new leasing activity next year, especially compared to one of your peers that gave '23 guidance that implies a step-down from macro tower new leasing activity. So, I guess the question is really your '22 guide this year for $67 million in new leasing activity. Do you think we're going to look back on that as a high watermark or do you think that there is actually room for that to grow going forward?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "David Guarino", "section_number": 75, "uuid": "8ab87c2b-6b24-4bf5-86b3-4b57e75c6716", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Green Street Advisors"}

section.text: I'm glad you asked that question, because when -- when we're conveying good feelings about next year, it's exactly around that number for 2022, that same calculation and that same thing that we will be posting when we start our bridge for next year -- next earnings release, that's really what we're speaking to. So I think I just answered your question.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jeffrey A. Stoops", "section_number": 76, "uuid": "506bda72-6af0-400b-ac38-eba1fba3064b", "speaker_title": "Director, President and Chief Executive Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: All right. I can -- I can read that direction [Phonetic]. Second one then, switching gears on it, given the volatility and the -- the pretty rapid change, we've seen this year and a lot of foreign currencies, maybe not the experience in Brazil, but certainly a lot of other markets, have you reconsidered how you underwrite the risk for international investments relative to, which you might have been doing at the start of the year?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "David Guarino", "section_number": 77, "uuid": "46957a81-6ea6-41ab-a918-447e11f42e38", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Green Street Advisors"}

section.text: Not really because the rate of currency movement is largely been matched off by the CPI's in those countries.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Brendan T. Cavanagh", "section_number": 78, "uuid": "0848b275-75b4-45c8-8590-48a27f3b4ba1", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: And all of our revenues in those countries are -- escalated based on CPI.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jeffrey A. Stoops", "section_number": 79, "uuid": "8690f706-22c7-43fc-a728-98f0706b5779", "speaker_title": "Director, President and Chief Executive Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: Pardon.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "David Guarino", "section_number": 80, "uuid": "0a300b96-57f6-4d78-9824-53d41ca8be7e", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Green Street Advisors"}

section.text: There'll be some minor exceptions to that plus or minus, but in general, that -- that relationship has helped.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jeffrey A. Stoops", "section_number": 81, "uuid": "2abc1c47-5df8-46fd-9233-07c85b3d0936", "speaker_title": "Director, President and Chief Executive Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: Thanks.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "David Guarino", "section_number": 82, "uuid": "314f008b-f7b5-4184-b15b-93fab25ba118", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Green Street Advisors"}

section.text: Great. Thanks for taking my question. Maybe just on the debt again, given the macro environment, has your ability to tap into the secured debt market changed recently and do you think that will continue to remain a primary source of funding going forward?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Brendan Lynch", "section_number": 84, "uuid": "8d5895fe-a24a-4db4-9669-864fcc7859a0", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Barclays"}

section.text: Yea. Brendan, we do we do think that it will remain a primary source of funding for us. Our ability to tap into it has not really been impacted. This -- it's really just a question of cost that's -- that's the only question mark. But the access to capital and having plenty of capital available to us in those markets still remains very strong.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jeffrey A. Stoops", "section_number": 85, "uuid": "4b6d2a47-8647-40e9-9f92-2879b7f8b40f", "speaker_title": "Director, President and Chief Executive Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: Okay, great. And then just one other question. It looks like your discretionary capex guidance came down by about $35 million for the year, is that related to the labor availability or supply chain constraints or other rising costs that might be linked to a slowdown in development projects?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Brendan Lynch", "section_number": 86, "uuid": "a5f17c3b-c4f7-4e20-9420-0d08b91127cf", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Barclays"}

section.text: No. It's mostly just timing of some smaller acquisitions and when we think they're going to close.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jeffrey A. Stoops", "section_number": 87, "uuid": "28c3b539-cd12-44fb-ada5-978aedc44ebd", "speaker_title": "Director, President and Chief Executive Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: Okay. Very good. Thank you.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Brendan Lynch", "section_number": 88, "uuid": "088ae928-b6fd-4ad0-896d-f56844436322", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Barclays"}

section.text: Great. Thanks for taking the questions. Two if, I could. Jeff, you guys talked about commencements coming in a little bit quicker than expected, but could you update us on the backlog of unsigned lease applications? Where do you stand today relative to a year ago and last quarter? And then for Brendan, obviously international CPIs have been high, but have come down a little bit at least in Brazil. I guess if we put estimates aside, today inflation stayed where it's at, what should we be looking for -- for that escalator next year? Thanks.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Brandon Nispel", "section_number": 90, "uuid": "426203c3-5689-406e-a9ca-29f5d9c6db50", "speaker_title": "Analyst at KeyBanc Capital Markets"}

section.text: Yeah. In terms of our backlog for leases -- new leases and amendments, we are just a tad off of where we were at the end of second-quarter, which was one of the highest that we've had in many, many, many years. So we're still looking at a very, very strong backlog, which is underlies a lot of our optimism going forward. And, Brendan, I'm going to let you handle the second question.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jeffrey A. Stoops", "section_number": 91, "uuid": "529f42ab-0b2c-4ae0-af88-9b4ee3991a3e", "speaker_title": "Director, President and Chief Executive Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: Yeah. I mean, you're asking me to predict the CPI for next year in Brazil, which it's hard to do with certainty, especially given the recent elections and all that. We have to kind of see how that all settles out. But, I think high single digits is a reasonable assumption today and perhaps it could be higher than that, but I would target somewhere in that 8% to 10% range.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Brendan T. Cavanagh", "section_number": 92, "uuid": "6572a9ef-471e-4017-9767-c3ac17571b25", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: Well, I mean there's going to be a forward curve out there. I mean when we -- when we do planning around those things because, nobody has the accurate crystal ball on that. We rely on the published consensus forward curve.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Brandon Nispel", "section_number": 93, "uuid": "0ea8395a-f169-4b07-b325-41071b1df8d8", "speaker_title": "Analyst at KeyBanc Capital Markets"}

section.text: Yeah. I mean the big thing Brandon for us is some of it comes down to timing. Obviously, we have concentrated periods at which our leases escalate. So depending on where things are during those windows of time, it -- it has either a greater or lesser impact on our specific numbers.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jeffrey A. Stoops", "section_number": 94, "uuid": "9fa8d14c-c56a-4655-9ab7-59704e1c8dcc", "speaker_title": "Director, President and Chief Executive Officer at SBA Communications"}

section.text: Thank you.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Brandon Nispel", "section_number": 95, "uuid": "a19a1fef-6ccd-4f80-ac09-a7309a243fa9", "speaker_title": "Analyst at KeyBanc Capital Markets"}

section.text: Great. Thanks, Carolyn, and thank you all for joining us. We look forward to our next release in February, where we will talk about 2023. And happy Halloween.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jeffrey A. Stoops", "section_number": 97, "uuid": "3b4cba46-8c93-4d72-adf0-2ff07ceaf6e4", "speaker_title": "Director, President and Chief Executive Officer at SBA Communications"}

title: Q&A for SBAC (SBA Communications) on 10/31/22 5:00 PM ET
